question: By what other namesÂ  has Advaita Vedanta historically been referred to?
explanation: Vedanta literally means "the end of the Vedas" or "the ultimate knowledge of the Vedas". The Advaita (Non-dualism) Vedanta philosophy has been referred to by various names, such as Advaita-vada (speaker of Advaita), Abheda-darshan (view of non-difference), Dvaita-vada-pratisedha (denial of dual distinctions), and Kevala-dvaita (non-dualism of the isolated).
